Title.En: Shared Access for Family Electrically-Assisted Tricycle

Description.En:
By taking part in this challenge with the international company ACTIA, you participate in an ambitious project driven by the need to imagine new way of moving in metropolises for a more sustainable society. By engaging with international experts, you will explore solutions based on new technology with the possibility to make a real demonstration on an innovative electrically assisted tricycle. 

Are you a student in computer science, telecommunications, or electronics? If you are, then this challenge is for you with rich seminars on the topic of smart mobility, advanced technologies for localization, communication and service with the opportunity to work with an international team not only with teachers and researchers but also with concerned industrial and startup.

So become an actor of the new usage of shared vehicles for a sustainable society.

Title.En: Apply problem-solving in social service for smart mobility

NoteLiteral.En: Apply problem-solving in social service for smart mobility based on an electrically assisted tricycle prototype

Title.En: Work in an international project using cooperative methodology

NoteLiteral.En: Work in an international project using cooperative methodology to solve technological and social problem based on cross capabilities and  international behavior

Title.En: Understand distributed computing based on network

NoteLiteral.En: For example for ultra-wide band technology

Title.En: Shared Access for Family Electrically-Assisted Tricycle
Shared Access for Family Electrically-Assisted Tricycle

LegalName.En: INSTITUT NATIONAL DES SCIENCES APPLIQUEES DE TOULOUSE (INSA TOULOUSE)

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
**Evaluation**

Group assessment and evaluations based on presentations made midway through the face-to-face courses and at the end of the distance-learning courses.

After the évaluations, a price will be goes to the team who offers the best solution.

**Calendar summary:**

Mandatory attendance at all online and onsite sessions

Week1 (40): one slot of 2 hours:  explain the challenge and start to build international teams (between 6 to 8 people in each team)

Week 2 (41): standalone work (2-3 hours), slots of 20 minutes of exchange with each team about their ideas and Seminary on UWB technology

Week 3 (42): On-line 2 hours + personal work 4 hours, Project plan of the project (presentation+document)/ Web page of the project / collaborative tools (git, ..), presentation by students

Week 4 (43): 5 days on site of INSA Toulouse, Hackathon on mobility, companies’ visit, definition of sprints

Week 5 (45): On-line 2 hours + personal work 4 hours, Beginning of sprint 1 (focus on technology use and scenario tests), Seminary on ADAS

Week 6 (46): On-line 2 hours + personal work 4 hours, Project review (validation of sprint, demonstration of partial results, topics of next sprint)

Week 7 (47): personal work 4 hours+seminary, Beginning of sprint 2 (focus on technology use and envionment of tests), Seminary on Software Defined Vehicle SDV

Week 8 (48): On-line 2 hours + personal work 4 hours, Project review

Week 9 (49): personal work 4 hours, Beginning of sprint 3 (focus on development of each part and unitary tests)

Week 10 (50):  On-line 2 hours + personal work 4 hours, Project review and demonstration for final transfer
Using Ultra Wide Band Technology - A new way for smart mobility

The living spaces of today's urban inhabitants extend beyond the institutional and administrative perimeters of public action. Developments in travel have thus modified the city and the perceptions of space by its practitioners who have become hypermobile. Faced with these lifestyles which combine quality of life outside the city and flexibility of mobility by car, it is difficult to reintroduce public transport, which is poorly suited to scattered urbanization. Traditional mobility manufacturers, namely automobile manufacturers and equipment suppliers, are increasingly interested in ​​intermediate electric vehicles like electrically assisted tricycle for family moving.
The objective of this challenge is to think about mobility based on shared electrical medium vehicles and to focus on services needed to develop shared usage.

To apply, please upload:

- a CV,

- a detailed motivation letter, indicating why the applicant is interested in this kind of project, what are the added values of the applicants to this CBL and what are the previous experiences of the applicant in this domain (if any)

- a transcript of records

The prerequisites are study engineering cursus in the domain of ICT (Information and Communication Technologies).

Particular care will be given to the selection process to have a large range of students coming from different domains.
